Posts.Content: Jan 28, 2013 10:58AM Janipani wrote: WOW - thanks for all of the suggestions.  My BS said to use nothing - she'll have to put a gas mask on to remove the drain later this week.  This is really gross, and even after washing with irish spring (the 8 hour scent) doesn't get rid of it either!  Even the bed sheets, if it makes contact with the ALND pit holds the odor! BUT, I did come up with an out of the box idea to help save my clothes.   I'm using a panty liner in the armpit of my blouse now.  The ALWAYS THONG LINER has enough adhesive on the back to hold the liner in place all day.  This doesn't stop the odor, but does keep your clothes from staining. Welcome new out of the box ideas for the side effects.  Getting drain out Thursday - ya'll will probably hear me   hollering my yahooooooo dance to get rid of the appendage!  Janice
Posts.Title: YUCK! How to tame the Armpit BO Monster - Suggestions? Janipani Alive4Five

Posts.Content: Feb 6, 2013 08:42PM Janipani wrote: The odor I had was during the 3 weeks after Axcillary Dissection, and the drain was in.  Smell would make you gag.  It was definately a body odor, but not like any under arm perspiration I've ever smelled from my body.  Funny thing I did notice.  I was retaining LOTS of fluid in the axiliary area and around the scar, and skin was pinkish around that area, but no fever.  BS started me on an antibiotic just in case, and 3 days later, drained over 8 ounces of fluid during a needle aspiration - not fun.  When I started on the antibiotics, the smell kind of went away!  So nothing was showing that I actually had an infection, and pathology of the fluid, showed no infection either.  But...I haven't had to odor return, and finishing up on my 10th day of antibiotics.  I started using an alcohol swab to wipe every morning, and that's all right now, till MO tells me what kind to start using, if any. Janipani
Posts.Title: YUCK! How to tame the Armpit BO Monster - Suggestions? Janipani Alive4Five

Posts.Content: Jan 26, 2013 06:55PM Janipani wrote: Can someone explain if when the liquid in their drains went down to 30cc's did it start turning more concentrated and go from wheat color to pink?  Surgery was 1/7 and scheduled to get drain out 1/31.  Just wondering if this  color change is normal.  Any discussion on how the drain is removed and whether is hurts?  Do they just stitch the drain hole closed?  Trying to get answers from MDA-Houston over a weekend, just ain't happening... Thanks for any feedback.
Posts.Title: January 2013 Axcillary Lymph Node Dissection (ALND) Surgery Janipani New-girl

Posts.Content: Janipani wrote: I had my surgery on the 7th at MDA-Houston.  One drain in for 11 days now and getting about 200/day of fluid out.  How long did it take others to reach the 30 cc/day for 2 consecutive days requirement before they pull the drain? How did anyone else secure the dressing when their skin broke down and they couldn't use any kind of tape anymore?  I'm using ace bandages to hold the dressing in place, but they keep slipping over and under my boobs, so I'm constantly having to adjust them.  Any other ideas?  I was wondering if asports bra or a genie bra would clamp down to hard a cause draining to be restricted or slow? Any other ideas to hurry up the drainage?  Exercise, no excersize? Posts.Content: Jan 28, 2013 02:21PM Janipani wrote: Tangles - you can't do to much resting right now, that's what my BS kept enforcing, let your body heal, but that sure is hard for the head to follow. I'm in the same boat as you, with being told I'll need chemo, radiation and 5 yrs of hormone blockers...AND I am the bread winner, having to go/drive to work, think, analyze data, etc. It's not a physical job, but a heavy mental one.   I'm so scared of the "chemo brain" effect and how this could affect my type of work down the road.  I know fear is paralyzing so, we all need to get these fears (dragons) out and deal with them so we can find creative ways of working through the coming months  and that pink light at the end of the treatment tunnel.   Janice
Posts.Title: January 2013 surgery JRMH Lbwagner69

Posts.Content: Jan 21, 2013 03:38PM Janipani wrote: SMETHOT - I fell out laughing with your last sentance - that sounds like it came out of my mouth!  My drain has been in since 1/7 and how do you cover that thing up to go any where?  Some one needs to create a flatter one instead of a big fat round one that can't be concealed easily.  I've got the same issues with the back of the arm and armpit.  Do the sweat glands get pissed off with the nodes are removed?  I've having an issue with perspiration or some kind of sweat odor under that arm.  Gahross - any suggestions if we can't use deoderant? Janice
Posts.Title: January 2013 surgery JRMH Lbwagner69

Posts.Content: Jan 21, 2013 04:47PM Janipani wrote: SMETHOT- Woman you made me laugh out loud!!!  Here's the reason I'm leaving mine in.  My first cousin had the same issue, but her drain came out in 1 week,and they weren't documenting the fluid levels discarded daily.  BUT in one week, she had a serious infection, that caused weeks more of problems, worse than the drain bag thing.  So what I'm hearing, the longer you wear it, the more time your body has to figure out where to send the fluid.  If the body doesn't figure that out itself, Lymphedema could be the result.  So I'm trying to be a good girl and leave it there, noting the amounts is discard daily, and even noting the color and my body temperature.  Amasing enough, at night, my temps are always in the 99-100 range but in the mornings always 98ish MIRIPANDA - I'm only having pain after the ALND on 1/7/13 really in the rib cage, can't imagine why there.  Feels like some one kicked my in the ribs.  Pain under the arm is tolerable, but is probably not as much pain as it is "what the hell is that feeling" - is it numbness, tingling, etc.  It's new feelings that are hard to describe, but are in your conscience mind.  The pain is still coming from the dam drain in there, and now down to 120cc's of fluid the color of early morning pee - no pink.   Does anyone know if more or less exercise helps with the process of drainage dry up? Janice
Posts.Title: January 2013 surgery JRMH Lbwagner69
